From: "FIRE FOX" <firefox_y2k@...>

(OOC: I'm sorry that I haven't been posting. I had finals all this week, but 
they're over now, so I can post again.)

Tavatron sighed, Dinobot had been gone a long time. When he had left he had 
appeared angry with her. She new he didn't like it when others challenged 
him, neither did she. Tavatron crossed her arms and leaned against the wall. 
She hadn't followed him, the fact that he refused to look at her was enough 
to let her know that he didn't need her near him right now. She had dealt 
with her share of problems before, and knew when it was best to deal with 
them on your own, without the aid of another 'bot who thought they knew 
best.

Tavatron knew she had been too pushy, too quick to judge Dinobot. After all 
the years she had spent running from her own demons you'd figure she'd have 
learned somthing by now. Perhaps she wasn't cut out for this... this...

Tavatron angrily snarled to herself, she couldn't even get her thoughts 
straight! Slag, what if Dinobot had killed Cyber Claw while she was standing 
here contemplating her own history? Tavatron drew a deep breath, trying her 
best to quell her rising frustration. She would rather charge into battle 
weaponless and half-slagged than deal with her own growing uncertainty right 
now.

Tavatron sighed through clenched teeth, she knew what was troubling her, she 
just didn't want to face it. She knew Dinobot was something of a friend to 
her, at least that was one thing she could be certain of. Then why did she 
keep pushing him away? Why did she constantly feel the need to challenge 
him? To prove herself? The answer was simple, she was afraid to get to 
close, afraid that if she did, then lost him, she would not be able to 
recover. She had barely survived the death of her friend all those 
steller-cycles ago. If not for Optimus she probably wouldn't even be 
standing here now.

Tavatron closed her optics, her mind racing and spark pounding, as if she 
had just run a marathon, yet she had done no more than confront her worst 
fear. Tavatron opened her optics again before venturing into the hallway, 
cautiously sniffing the air. She didn't detect the sharp scent of 
mech-fluid, that was good. She quickly made her way down the hallway, 
following Dinobot's strong TM2 scent until she came to a hall that led 
nowhere. Odd, she thought, but stopped when she saw Dinobot at the end of 
the hall with Cyber Claw. She didn't want to startle the fem 'bot, so 
Tavatron quickly sheathed her staff. She contemplated stepping forward, thus 
making her presence known, but decided against it.

Tavatron leaned against the hallway wall, her arms crossed, waiting for 
Dinobot to finish talking with Cyber Claw.
